A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I really don't understand why critics loved this movie so much. Mark H\, Adam D\, the cinematography\, and the building relationship between Kylo and Rey were great. Rey\, Finn\, Poe\, Leia\, and script were okay. BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY\, the one thing I've been waiting for since they announced the Force Awaken\, never happened. No grand battle to send off Luke. No setting him up to be totally awesome in the future.All I wanted was an amazing fight scene and I would have forgiven the few shortfalls and long drawn out script. So I'll never see Luke shoot green lightning bolts from his fingertips like in the comics\, I'll never see him fly\, or do any other cool stuff that I hoped for. Instead\, all we got was an illusion. AHHHH. So mad. Remember the first time we saw Yoda fight...that's all I wanted. Was it that hard?
